Replace.Text: Plantations and Camps provide large adjacency bonuses to Beer Squares. Large cities with population 10 and above get +1 [ICON_Amenities] amenity from entertainment facilities.

Lance's characteristic religious activity area replaces the Holy Land, and the construction cost is lower. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Each adjacent area gives it a bonus [ICON_Faith] of Faith. The area no longer gets the adjacency bonus when it is adjacent to mountains. Adjacent [ICON_Faith] Faith bonuses also give [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, and squares with shrines give +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points per turn.

Lance is a melee unit with 3 [ICON_Movement] mobility in the classical period. It has a unique upgrade path for monks. When killing a unit, obtain [ICON_SCIENCE] technology value equal to 50% of the combat power of the killed unit. Combat power will continue to improve as technology is unlocked.

+3% [ICON_SCIENCE] technology for [ICON_Capital] capital per beer square in the country. [ICON_Capital] +30% [ICON_Production] Productivity for non-capital cities within 6 cells of the capital when constructing areas and urban projects; non-capital cities within 9 cells outside the 6-cell range have no debuff; other non-capital cities -10% to all outputs. [NEWLINE]The Oktoberfest project is available in cities with beer squares.

Bai Jikang, raise your glass! Your strong desire for knowledge and faith is a gift from heaven. If you can make people happy and healthy, you can inspire them to create great things. You will lead the people on the broad road and use your ingenuity to bring a bright and free future to the country.
